>=
 Hi there, 
> 
> I am planning to create an application of CPPNs that gener=
ate 3D 
> tetrahedral meshes to be used in physically-based simulations... =

The 
> CPPN will output material presence along with material properties 
=
like 
> Young's modulus (elasticity), Poisson's ratio (compressablity), 
> =
Density, Plasticity parameters... Then the resulting objects can be 
> simu=
lated in real-time via Finite Element Analysis.. And fitness 
can be 
> com=
puted from the results of the simulation.. 
> It's difficult to discretize =
the output of the CPPN into finite 
> elements, so this is the major issue =
for building such a system.. 
But 
> once such a system is built, it has un=
limited potential for 
evolving 
> any kind of structure...

> Peter
